ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńge lɔg tsɔ́ na shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ, é nuŋe pwɔʼ mbwó Ssé, mbà á ge gwɔ́ pfɔbɔ́ ngesáŋ ntsíŋ, à pÿɛ́ mevɛ́ ndumó, ńkẅiʼi lìi mǒ;
en: “When anyone presents a grain offering   as an offering to the Lord, it is to consist of fine flour.  # 2:1 Gn 18:6; Ex 29:2,40; Lv 2:1–7 He is to pour olive oil  # 2:1 Gn 28:18; 35:14 on it, put frankincense on it,  # 2:1 Ex 30:34

ngiemboon: é lɔg tó náa mbwó penkʉ́ Áloŋ pembàŋa pie ée panuŋepwɔʼ, à ge lɔgɔ pwó yé túʼ tà à lúe, é lɔg mevɛ́ pʉe, é piŋ pú néŋe lìi mǒ ntsèm, anùŋepwɔʼ tuɔ ndùm jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, lezíŋ ée lê «kímtè», é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mmó pwɔʼ gie mé tuɔ tà á pú shÿó, agyě kwɔ́ʼ ḿboŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: and bring it to Aaron’s sons the priests. The priest will take a handful of fine flour and oil from it, along with all its frankincense, and will burn this memorial portion   of it on the altar, a food offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.

ngiemboon: Apfwɔ̀ʼɔ mmó pwɔʼ na shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ, à cʉ́ʼʉ ye Áloŋ pâ penkʉ́ pé pembàŋa. Áa kìb gie áa kwàʼ ye Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mélàʼmie á fǒ na pwɔʼ gẅie mé tǔɔ tà e pú shÿó ńtí Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: But the rest of the grain offering will belong to Aaron and his sons; it is the holiest part   of the food offerings to the Lord.

ngiemboon: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgee ńnuŋe pwɔʼ lé mmó gie á fóo na shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ, á piŋ ngwɔ́ gie mé ge káŋa tsɛ̀ɛ letǔɔ mbelég, mbà á zɛ́te ngie à gwɔ́ pfɔbɔ́ ngesáŋ ntsíŋ té mvòŋ gie mé ně ńdɔg mevɛ́ ḿbʉe, kà pɔ́ tsɔ́ ntí kàshÿò té mvòŋ gie mé ně ńdɔg mevɛ́ ńzɔ́ʼte wɔ́ɔ té mvòŋ, kà pɔ́ mekèle té mvòŋ mie mé lɔ̌g mevɛ́ ńzɔ́ʼte wɔ́ɔ.
en: “When you present a grain offering baked in an oven, it is to be made of fine flour, either unleavened cakes   mixed with oil or unleavened wafers  # 2:4 Ex 29:2,23; Lv 7:12; 8:26; Nm 6:15,19; 1Ch 23:29 coated with oil.

ngiemboon: Ńké ngwɔ́ gie ammó pwɔʼ yé, áa mmó gie á fó nkáʼ, mé káŋa na gwág, mbà á ge gwɔ́ pfɔbɔ́ ngesáŋ ntsíŋ té mvòŋ gie mé lɔ̌g mevɛ́ ḿbʉe.
en: If your offering is a grain offering prepared on a griddle,   it is to be unleavened bread  # 2:5 Ex 12:8; Mt 16:6,11–12; 1Co 5:6–8 made of fine flour mixed with oil.

ngiemboon: À ge záʼte mekèm mekèm, é pÿɛ mevɛ́ mǒ, à gwɔ́ mmó pwɔʼ gie á fó na shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ.
en: Break it into pieces and pour oil on it; it is a grain offering.

ngiemboon: Ńké ńgwɔ́ gie ammó pwɔʼ ye nyìŋ, áa mmó gie mé laga nkáʼ, á gie mé káŋa tsɛ̀ɛ felepân, mbà á zɛ́te ngie à gwɔ́ pfɔbɔ́ ngesáŋ ntsíŋ gie mé lɔ̌g mevɛ́ ḿbʉe.
en: If your offering is a grain offering prepared in a pan,   it is to be made of fine flour with oil.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńdɔgɔ mmó pwɔʼ gie á fó na shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ ńgee ńnuŋe, mbà à lɔgɔ púʼu ńgee ńnáa mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbà à ge náa mbwó nùŋepwɔʼ, à leen ńké ńdɔg ńgʉa né jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ.
en: When you bring to the Lord the grain offering made in any of these ways, it is to be presented to the priest, and he will take it to the altar.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à nuŋe pwɔʼ ge kẅile gie à ge náa mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é tuɔ ndùm lenuŋé pwɔʼ, é gwɔ́ pwɔʼ lɔg ńkímte, ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ we Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Ńdɔg ńgwɔ́ mmó pwɔʼ gie mé túɔ tà á pú shÿó, agyě kwɔ́ʼ ḿboŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: The priest will remove the memorial portion   from the grain offering and burn it on the altar, a food offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.

ngiemboon: Apfwɔ̀ʼɔ mmó pwɔʼ na shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ, à cʉ́ʼʉ ye Áloŋ pâ penkʉ́ pé pembàŋa. Áa kìb gie áa kwàʼ ye Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mélàʼmie á fó na pwɔʼ gẅie mé tǔɔ tà é pú shÿó ńtí Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.»
en: But the rest of the grain offering will belong to Aaron and his sons;   it is the holiest part of the food offerings to the Lord.

ngiemboon: «Tà nyìŋ láʼ ńgwaa nyɛte tsɔ́ mmó pwɔʼ gie á fóo na shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ, á gie à ge náa mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńnéŋ mvòŋ mǒ. Á nue á té zɛ́te ngie nyìŋ láʼ ńdɔg mvòŋ kà melwòŋwáʼ wɔ́ɔ, ńnyɛte shúm pwɔʼ sie mé ge tuɔ ńtí Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: “No grain offering that you present to the Lord is to be made with yeast, for you are not to burn   any yeast  # 2:11 Ex 12:14 or honey  # 2:11 Jdg 14:8 as a food offering to the Lord.

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ pi lɔg ntwó shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ, ńtó, ńnáa mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Táʼ, ńké le tuɔ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ páʼ mmó pwɔʼ gie agyě kwɔ́ʼ ḿboŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́.»
en: You may present them to the Lord as an offering of firstfruits,   but they are not to be offered on the altar as a pleasing aroma.

ngiemboon: «Ɔ̀ ge gwaa náa yɛ̌ mmó pwɔʼ wɔ́ɔ gie á fóo na shúm sie ɔ̀ lagá nkáʼ, é néŋ ngwáŋ mǒ. Ɔ̀ te láʼ nyé mmó pwɔʼ jú gie á fóo na shúm sie ɔ̀ lagá nkáʼ té ngwáŋ kʉ̀a Ssé jù wɔ́. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn nge ná pɔ́ kɔ́ mbwó Ssé wɔ́ɔ, ɔ̀ péle ngwáŋ mǒ.»
en: You are to season each of your grain offerings with salt; you must not omit from your grain offering the salt of the covenant   with your God. You are to present salt with each of your offerings.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgee náa mmó pwɔʼ mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gie á fóo na ntwó shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ, mbà ɔ̀ ge ná metsɔ̀ʼ ngesáŋ mie mé kaŋá mmɔ̌g, mbɔɔ gie mé shÿɔ̌ʼ, e lɔgɔ púʼu, ńgwɔ́ shúm pwɔʼ sie é fóo na ntwó shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ.
en: “If you present a grain offering of firstfruits to the Lord, you are to present fresh heads of grain, crushed kernels, roasted on the fire, for your grain offering of firstfruits.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge pÿɛ mevɛ́, é piŋ zába lìi ndumó. Áa púʼu, ńgwɔ́ mmó pwɔʼ gie á fóo na shúm sie mé lagá nkáʼ.
en: You are to put oil and frankincense on it; it is a grain offering.

ngiemboon: Anùŋepwɔʼ pɔ́ɔnte, ńtuɔ tsɔ́ gwoŋó memvòm mie mé shÿɔ̌ʼ pɔ́ tsɔ́ gwoŋó mevɛ́, é piŋ tuɔ lìi pɔ́ ntsèm, lezíŋ ée lê «kímtè», e lɔg ḿbú ńgwɔ́ we Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Letuɔ sɛ̌ shúm tà é pú shÿó, à gwɔ́ lélɔg ńkímte ngie wɛ̌ pwɔʼ ké ḿbú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ we Ssé.
en: The priest will then burn some of its crushed kernels and oil with all its frankincense as a food offering to the Lord.
